It is native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Cladostemon paradoxus is noted for its unique floral structure, which includes stamens that are often longer than the petals, adding to its botanical intrigue.
